hillbillies.model

Class Task

  • java.lang.Object
    • hillbillies.model.Task

  • public class Task
extends java.lang.Object
    A class of Tasks than can be assigned to Units, with a name, priority, activity, list of schedulers, variable declarations and a selected coordinate.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Kevin Algoet & Jeroen Depuydt 1ba Informatica
    Invariants:
  • Each Task must have proper Schedulers.
        hasProperSchedulers()
  • Each Task must have a proper Unit.
        hasProperUnit()
    • Note:
    Repository link: https://github.com/KivinA/ProjectOGP

      Create a new Task with the given name, priority, activity Statement and a selected coordinate.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Task

        @Deprecated
public Task(java.lang.String name,
                         int priority)
        Deprecated. 
        Initialize this Task with a given name and priority, and an ineffective coordinate and activity.
        Parameters:
        name - The name for this Task.
        priority - The priority for this Task.
        Effect:
        Initialize this Task with the given name as its name, the given priority as its priority, an ineffective activity Statement and an ineffective selected coordinate.
            this(name, priority, null, null)
        Note:
        This constructor should only be used as a quick alternative for easy test setups. DO NOT USE THIS CONSTRUCTOR TO INITIALIZE A TASK IN A CLASS. Use the other constructor.

      • Task

        public Task(java.lang.String name,
            int priority,
            Statement activity,
            int[] selectedCube)
        Create a new Task with the given name, priority, activity Statement and a selected coordinate.
        Parameters:
        name - The name for this new Task.
        priority - The priority for this new Task.
        activity - The activity Statement for this new Task.
        selectedCube - The selected coordinate for this new Task.
        Postconditions:
      • The name of this new Task is equal to the given name.
            new.getName() == name
      • The activity of this new Task is equal to the given activity.
            new.getActivity() == activity
      • The selected coordinate of this Task is equal to the given selected coordinates, if it is effective. Otherwise the selected coordiante of this new Task is ineffective.
            if (selectedCube != null)
             new.getSelected() == Arrays.copyOf(selectedCube, selectedCube.length)
            else
             new.getSelected() == null
        • Effect:
        The priority of this Task is set to the given priority.
            this.setPriority(priority)

    • Method Detail

      • terminate

        public void terminate()
        Terminate this Task.
        Postconditions:
      • The terminated state of this Task equals true.
            new.isTerminated() == true
      • The list of Schedulers is empty.
            new.getSchedulers().isEmpty() == true
      • The map of variables of this Task is empty.
            new.variables.isEmpty() == true
      • The activity Statement of this Task is ineffective.
            new.getActivity() == null
        • Effect:
        Remove this Task from all Schedulers to which this Task is attached.
            for each scheduler in getAllSchedulers():
             scheduler.removeTask(this)

public boolean isTerminated()
        Check whether this Task is terminated.

public int getPriority()

      • setPriority

        @Raw
public void setPriority(int priority)
        Set the priority of this Task to the given priority.
        Parameters:
        priority - The new priority for this Task.
        Postcondition:
        The priority of this new Task is equal to the given priority.
            new.getPriority() == priority

      • getUnit

        @Basic
 @Raw
public Unit getUnit()
        Return the Unit that is currently executing this Task.

      • canHaveAsUnit

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsUnit(Unit unit)
        Check whether this Task can be assigned to the given Unit.
        Parameters:
        unit - The Unit to check.
        Returns:
        If this unit is terminated, true if and only if the given Unit is ineffective. Otherwise, true if and only if the given Unit is ineffective or if this Unit is effective and has this Task as its assigned Task.
            if (isTerminated())
             then result == (unit == null)
            if (unit == null)
             then result == true
            else
             result == (unit.getTask() == this)

      • setUnit

        @Raw
public void setUnit(@Raw
                          Unit unit)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Set the Unit that will execute this Task to the given Unit.
        Parameters:
        unit - The Unit that will be executing this Task.
        Postcondition:
        The Unit to which this new Task is asssigned is equal to the given Unit.
            new.getUnit() == unit
        Throws:
        ModelException - This Task cannot have the given Unit as its Unit. | ! canHaveAsUnit(unit)
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • hasProperUnit

        public boolean hasProperUnit()
        Check whether this Task has a proper Unit attached to it.
        Returns:
        True if and only if this Task can have its Unit as its Unit, if this Task is terminated or if this Task isn't terminated, and the Unit has this Task as its Task.
            if (canHaveAsUnit(getUnit())
             then
             if (isTerminated())
             then result == true
             else result == (getUnit().getTask() == this)
            else result == false

      • getAllSchedulers

        @Basic
 @Raw
public java.util.Set<Scheduler> getAllSchedulers()
        Return a set which contains every Scheduler where this Task is one of the Tasks of the Scheduler.

      • hasAsScheduler

        @Raw
public boolean hasAsScheduler(Scheduler scheduler)
        Check whether the given Scheduler is attached to this Task.
        Parameters:
        scheduler - The given Scheduler to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given Scheduler is attached to this Task as one of its Schedulers.
            result == schedulers.contains(scheduler)

      • canHaveAsScheduler

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsScheduler(Scheduler scheduler)
        Check whether this Task can have the given Scheduler as one of its Schedulers.
        Parameters:
        scheduler - The Scheduler to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given Scheduler is effective and if the given Scheduler has this Task listed as one of its Tasks.
            result == (scheduler != null) && (scheduler.hasAsTask(this))

      • addScheduler

        @Raw
public void addScheduler(Scheduler scheduler)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Add the given Scheduler to the list of Schedulers to which this Task is assigned.
        Parameters:
        scheduler - The given Scheduler to add.
        Postcondition:
        This Task has the given Scheduler as one of its Schedulers.
            new.hasAsScheduler(scheduler) == true
        Throws:
        ModelException - This Task cannot have the given Scheduler as one of its Schedulers. | !canHaveAsScheduler(scheduler)
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • canRemoveAsScheduler

        @Raw
public boolean canRemoveAsScheduler(Scheduler scheduler)
        Check whether this Task can remove the given Scheduler from its list of Schedulers.
        Parameters:
        scheduler - The given scheduler to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given Scheduler is effective and doesn't have this Task listed as one of its Tasks.
            result == (scheduler != null) && (!scheduler.hasAsTask(this))

      • removeScheduler

        @Raw
public void removeScheduler(Scheduler scheduler)
                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Remove the given Scheduler from the list of Schedulers to which this Task is assigned.
        Parameters:
        scheduler - The given Scheduler to remove.
        Postcondition:
        This Task no longer has the given Scheduler as one of its Schedulers.
            new.hasAsScheduler(scheduler) == false
        Throws:
        ModelException - The given Scheduler cannot be removed from the list of Schedulers. | !canRemoveAsScheduler(scheduler)
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • hasProperSchedulers

        public boolean hasProperSchedulers()
        Check whether this Task has proper Schedulers attached to it.
        Returns:
        True if and only if each Scheduler of this Task's collection of Schedulers is effective and if this Task can have each Scheduler as one of its Schedulers.
            (for each Scheduler in schedulers:
             if (Scheduler == null)
             then result == false
             if (!canHaveAsScheduler(Scheduler))
             then result == false)
            result == true

      • getActivity

        @Basic
 @Raw
public Statement getActivity()
        Get the activity of this Task.

      • executeActivity

        @Raw
public void executeActivity()
        Execute the activity of this Task.
        Postcondition:
        The activity of this Task is ineffective, if the activity has been executed.
            if (getActivity().isExecuted())
             then getActivity() == null
        Effect:
        Execute the activity of this Task, if it hasn't been executed already.
            if (!getActivity().isExecuted())
             then this.getActivity().execute(this)

      • hasAsVariable

        @Basic
 @Raw
public boolean hasAsVariable(java.lang.String variableName)
        Check whether the given variable is in the map of variables.
        Parameters:
        variableName - The name of the variable to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given variable name is in the map of variables as a key.
            result == variables.containsKey(variableName)

      • addVariable

        @Raw
public void addVariable(java.lang.String variableName,
                              Expression value)
        Add the given variable to the list of variables, along with its value.
        Parameters:
        variableName - The name of the variable.
        value - The value of the variable.
        Postconditions:
      • The given variable name is added to the set of keys of the variables map.
            new.variables.keySet().contains(variableName)
      • The value of the given variable name is equal to the given value.
            new.getVariableValue(variableName) == value

      • replaceValue

        @Raw
public void replaceValue(java.lang.String variableName,
                               Expression value)
        Replace the value of the already existing variable with the new given variable.
        Parameters:
        variableName - The name of the variable to replace the value of.
        value - The value to replace.
        Postcondition:
        The given variable name has the new given value as its value.
            new.getVariableValue(variableName) == value

      • getVariableValue

        @Basic
 @Raw
public Expression getVariableValue(java.lang.String variableName)
        Get the value which is mapped to the given variable name in the list of variables.
        Parameters:
        variableName - The variable name that is linked to the value to return.

 @Raw
 @Immutable
public int[] getSelected()
        Get the selected cube of this Task.
